prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am sorry about how you are feeling. I can understand how being in that situation can cause you to have anxiety

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Do you have a support system that can help?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: It comes and goes in waves. Sometimes I feel strong and other times I feel so weak.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I personally have dealt with depression and i know how isolation all of that can be. Sometimes i find it helps to give yourself time to feel what you need to feel first before trying to feel better.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I personally have dealt with depression and i know how isolation all of that can be. Sometimes i find it helps to give yourself time to feel what you need to feel first before trying to feel better.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes. That is true, but it can be so overwhelming at times.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Yes it definitely can.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: What are some things that you do to feel better?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I personally like to write out my feelings in a journal and sometimes i listen to music that makes me feel happy. Do you have things that you enjoy that you have tried to do?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I personally like to write out my feelings in a journal and sometimes i listen to music that makes me feel happy. Do you have things that you enjoy that you have tried to do?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I also journal. It helps sometimes. But I can't stop thinking about my family and how hard this is on them also.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you tried speaking to them about your feelings?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes. They are very supportive. That is one of the things that make me so sad. I hate the thought that this disease may take me away from them.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I can understand why this is all sad. I would feel the same in your position.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: It is getting somewhat better and you have been so much help just being their and letting me vent.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am glad its better glad I can let you vent.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes. You have been a help. I hope that you have a great day.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am glad i could help you. I hope you have a great day yourself.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I will since you made it better. Have a very Merry Christmas.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Thank you and Merry Christmas!

samples.label: V5

samples.situation: With everything going on, my depression has taking a turn for the worst.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: This pandemic is causing me a lot of anxiety and stress.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is there anything that's specifically causing the stress? Probably some big changes?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: My job safety, financial situation, get evicted and much more.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you're facing some potential instability which can definitely increase anxiety. What strategies have you been trying so far?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: None so far. I have no idea. Any suggestions?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: For the short term, have you tried looking in to meditation or breathing exercises? For a longer approach, have you thought about gaining some new skills for the job market?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Oh ok. That is helpful. I've been reading to past the time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sounds like reading might be a good way to get your mind out of the anxiety loop, does that sound right?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, sometimes.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That's great! Maybe you can take that a step further and read some material on mindfulness

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Not my type of books, but I'll definitely look into it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Job stability is also a concern for me

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I definitely fear for my future if I lose my job.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So, you don't feel like you have a secure spot right now, is that right?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is correct.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Can you tell me what your job is?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I work for an insurance company. Low level employee.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Ok, have there been any talks about layoffs? Or any concerns about your performance?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No, but due to this pandemic, layoff is a concern.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So you're nervous about things that might happen in the future, but there's no talks about anything concrete?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been feeling kind of stuck with my job and my anxiety seems to be growing.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really tough. It’s understandable to feel stuck, especially with everything going on. How have you been coping with those feelings?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I've been trying to stay busy with tasks at work, but sometimes it just feels overwhelming.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It’s good that you’re keeping busy. Remember, it’s okay to take breaks and give yourself some time to relax. Is there anything you enjoy doing outside of work that might help bring some calm?

samples.situation: One of my classes is extremely difficult and my professor is not responsive.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's alright. Definitely not as cold as last year which is something to be slightly thankful for.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well let's be grateful for small mercies :). How are you feeling in yourself though? Is there anything you'd like to talk about?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm worried about grad school

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Ah I am sorry to hear that. Please try not to worry too much as it's a common worry to have. Do you want to tell me the details?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Sure. One of my classes is extremely difficult and the professor has not been responsive at all. The TA is kind enough to make time to help me with homework, but my grades are still not great. It makes me feel really dumb and undeserving to be in that class

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So you are feeling as though you are in the wrong place? Do you feel as though you might fail your class completely?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I want to be in the program, it's just that I feel like everyone is so much smarter than me and my performance in that class makes me question my admission into the programs sometimes. When I feel like this after submitting homework, I end up crying because I just want to do well. I enjoy this field, just not this  class in particular.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm afraid of failing, but I'm not sure if that should be a concern either. Over the past 3 years, no one has gotten a grade lower than a B.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: But do you really think that you would have been admitted to the class if you were not up to the standard? Do you think that maybe most of your classmates are secretly feeling the same?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes I think about that. At the same time, I feel like it's unfair to compare myself to others.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: This sounds like it might be a self esteem issue and not about your grades. I have felt this sort of thing myself and I do know how awful it is to be so hard on yourself.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: So what do I do about it? I don't want to keep feeling like this

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you thought about seeing a therapist? Does your school have any free therapy programmes you could use?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I spoke with the TA the other day, and they suggested I try to form a study group with other students from the class.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a great idea! It might help to connect with others who are facing similar challenges. How did you feel about the suggestion?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I think it could be helpful, but I'm also nervous about reaching out. What if they don't want to study together?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely understandable to feel that way. Maybe you could start by just asking a couple of classmates if they're interested and see how it goes? It could take some pressure off you too.

samples.situation: I don't know what to do. I need to get a job and I have a lot of student debt.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yea, I think that's true. Other people say that I am a quitter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: They say I quit everything

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you gone and smoke to your local job centers? They can often times find suitable jobs or even creative suggestions that can utilize your skills and even grown them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No, I'm not aware of any local job centers around me. I mostly have been looking online at places like indeed.com

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm not sure what you mean by "job center," I guess, either

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Refusing to finish something that does not benefit your end goal isn't quitting its merely switching strategies to your personal end goal

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Oh, yea. That's a good reframe. I like that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I suppose, I'm just getting older and wish I had better, more stable options available to me. All this education hasn't really left with me many hard skills, I feel

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am from North Carolina and in every city there are job centers, you can look them up by that title, they have people there who can help you find work based on your personality and skills. as well helping with resumes, interveiws, computers, all kinds of things.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Interesting. I guess I can look into that. I am from Ohio. That's not bad advice.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am somewhat kicking myself for paying so much money on education that wasn't really worth that much. I guess there isn't much I can do about that, though

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Im sorry you feel that way but education is never a wasted effort it can only make you level up even if you choose not to actively use what you acquire. Its always nice to have a big back up arsenal so you have options when something you want does turn up.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Im really glad that suggestion might be helpful for you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you checked to see if any of the credits you have earned already are transferable to another degree you may find of interest?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I suppose there can be truth in that. I had a friend say that as well, that education is never a wasted effort. I agree sometimes. I should have thought about the program more before I went into it, but ah, oh well. Nothing I can do about it, now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No, it wouldn't be transferable.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have though about doing some grad school for something bio related. I don't know.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm 30 now and getting burned out, to be honest

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Anyway, you've said a lot of nice and helpful things. I don't want to take too much time from you. After all, you won your bonus money. But, I really do appreciate you talking to me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: oh man that sucks, I am sorry. Thirty really is not old in our current time. shoot alot of people dont event start school till that age for whatever reason or the other.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about how to tackle the job search, especially since I'm not sure what skills I can market.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel that way. What specific skills do you think you might have that could be appealing to employers?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I guess I have good communication and research skills from my education, but I just don't know how to present that.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Those are valuable skills! Maybe you could focus on creating a resume that highlights those strengths and consider practicing your pitches to feel more confident.

samples.situation: I am currently studying for an exam that I need to do for work.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am anxious about an upcoming test.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It's normal to feel nervous whenever we have an important assessment coming.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I myself would always be really anxious whenever I had any finals back in college.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes I have a bunch of courses that I need to do for my work, it certainly keeps me busy.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I would suggest that you study as much as you can. The more prepared you are for that test, the more manageable you will find it and the less stressed you will feel.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes I am pretty good about that but it just kills my free time because I am working full time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand. However, you need to be able to find some time dedicated to your school activities. You are the one who needs to decide how to insert it in your schedule.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes honestly I am the main driver behind me doing all this schooling it is just going to be good for my career and I don't just want to stand still.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I agree, once you have your career set up you won't have to worry about working and studying anymore. You will be doing what you like for a good living. Think about the future.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is certainly the plan

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Just remember not to stress too much about it. It's just one test at the end of the day, you can do this!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes I am not super worried about it it is more the stress from not having free time, also insurance textbooks are not extremely exciting.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I know that I told you to try to fit school time into your schedule, but the same goes with leisure time for yourself. Find an activity that you enjoy and try to dedicate at least an hour a day to it, be it exercising, playing videogames, reading a book.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I feel like I can’t really enjoy my free time because I’m always thinking about my upcoming coursework.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That makes sense. It can be tough to switch off when you have so much on your mind. Have you tried any strategies to help you relax during your free time?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I’ve tried watching some shows, but I still find my mind wandering back to studying.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It’s great that you’re making an effort to unwind. Perhaps setting a specific time for relaxation, even if it’s short, could help you focus on enjoying those moments without distractions.

samples.situation: Parents are pressuring me to become a doctor

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah i'm leaning that. i already graduated university. i fulfilled half of their dream.  you think telling them my honest opinion will be a good idea?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think you need to be prepared for them to not be happy with your honest opinion, but that just because they aren't happy with it doesn't mean it's wrong.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thanks great advise. i will definitely be prepapred. i don't care if i dissapoint them. it's my life not theres. i'll live with the consequences

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Keep in mind that from their point of view, they want the best for you because they love you, so try not to burn the bridge or salt the earth.  I had a rocky relationship with my dad after college too, but it's better now.  They will survive, and you will thrive.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you. yeah i get that. but they should be happy for me. They cant make decisions for me all the time. let me free!!!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That feeling is totally understandable, I felt the same way.  They need to let you find your own way, it's apart of growing up.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you. at least someone agrees with me.  Do i have the right to be angry at them?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: The anger is understandable, but I think it is slightly misplaced as they are not trying to hurt you.  You are frustrated by their lack of understanding and their judgement of your choices, but you and they are both attempting to solve the same problem of your happiness.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Good advice. you are great at this.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That's very kind of you to say, thank you :-)

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you for the great talk. im not as angry anymore. will take there feelings into consideration

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You are a great listener and have a lot of passion, I think you will be successful for sure.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Another thing about that situation is that my parents want me to decide my future direction this week. I'm torn between pursuing a career in medicine, which they want, or following my passion for art, which I feel strongly about. It's tough because I know they expect me to take the safe route.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: I can understand how challenging that must be for you.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I really need to figure it out soon because they expect a decision by tomorrow. Should I stick to medicine and keep them happy, or follow my heart into art? What do you think I should do?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really overwhelming. I'm here for you as you navigate through this.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it contains only general empathy despite the Seeker's explicit request for urgent help with a decision between two options, failing to provide any practical guidance.

samples.situation: I've been experiencing repeated romantic rejections from potential mates.

prefix_dialog.content:
hello
how are you today

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

samples.situation: I need to leave my job as I do not make enough money, however I love my job and hate to leave.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I've been better

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sounds like you might be having a rough day.  Is there something specific on your mind?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I've seen an increase in expenses recently and need to find a new job, however I really enjoy what I do. I'm just feeling very sad about it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: An uptick in expenses seems to be an issue for a lot of us right now.  Glad to hear you enjoy your job.  Sounds like you are a bit torn about leaving a great company.  Do I understand that right?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's right. It's hard to know what to do.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can absolutely understand why your situation is difficult.  Have you had a chance to talk with your manager about another opportunity within the company that provides higher compensation?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I've considered it, but I unfortunately work for a non-profit and the likelihood of them being able to offer another opportunity is pretty low. Do you think it would still be worth it to ask?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That's fantastic that you work for a non-profit.  I've been looking to transition to an opportunity like that sometime in the future.  It must be so fulfilling.  I think asking would be a great first step.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's really nice to have mission driven work and would definitely recommend it. It's unfortunate that it's challenging for many non-profits to pay as much as they should. Thank you for the advice! I'm really hoping I don't have to leave.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: As a secondary plan, have you had the chance to look at positions with similar non-profits?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have searched around a bit, but have come to find that there's not many similar non-profits where I live currently. I may consider relocating if it's the right job, but that's a lot of additional stress.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Additional stress right now certainly isn't anything anyone needs.  You may want to consider looking at resources online that provide comparable salary information for your position.  That would help with having a conversation with your current employer if you are being paid less than average.  Since they are a non-profit, I'm sure they would want to do everything to help you with your financial situation.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's a great idea - I have done some research but just kind of assumed most non-profits would be in the same boat. I'll do some looking around to see what I can find

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds like a great next step.  Is there anything else on your mind that you'd like to chat about?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That was all for today. Thank you for your help!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It was my pleasure.  Have a wonderful rest of your day and keep your head high!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about how much I appreciate the people I work with at the non-profit. It really makes this decision tougher.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It sounds like you have a strong connection with your coworkers, which can definitely make things more complicated. Have you had any conversations with them about your situation?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I haven't really talked to anyone about it yet. I'm not sure how to bring it up without it sounding too negative.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's understandable. Perhaps you could start by sharing your feelings about your work and then mention the financial concerns. It might open up a supportive dialogue without creating too much pressure.

samples.situation: My girlfriend has a rare condition that can be very expensive to just keep her healthy. Her grandparents are supporting us and the grandmother's husband is going through dementia and making everyone stressed and could possibly die leaving 3 houses to pay off.

prefix_dialog.content: Not good.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What's wrong, do you feel like sharing?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content:
Well, my girlfriend and her grandmother are extremely
 depressed.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: I always feel like the way I look does not live up to the expectations of those close to me. This makes me very anxious when I go to meet with them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hello

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Hello! How are you doing?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am anxious

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm sorry to hear that. What is the cause of your anxiety?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: My friends and my family place a lot of value on how one looks. Every time I meet with them they have a comment on how I should improve on something. It makes me stressed out because I feel like I am not good enough.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am sorry you are having to deal with this. Are you concerned about your own looks because you constantly hear this feedback from those close to you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes. I feel that I am not thin enough, pretty enough, that my clothes are not nice enough etc

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I myself have gone through similar feelings when I was a teenager. I had body image issues for the longest time and my way of resolving it was through proper diet and exercise. Are you happy with how you look personally irrespective of what others opinions are?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It is hard to feel ok when I keep hearing that I am missing something. I don't even think I need to lose weight. It is just that my friends think model thin is what beauty is. I would have to starve myself to achieve that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If you are comfortable with your weight then why are you so concerned with what everyone around you says or thinks?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Because they are the people I spend time with. I want to be accepted and I want them to like me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you care more about what others think of you than how you feel about yourself.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I wish I could not care about what they think but I do. I don't know how to not let their opinions not bother me

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you ever tried affirmations or heard of this before?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No. What is that?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Affirmations are positive statements you think about yourself. What I like to do when I'm feeling really anxious is say three positive things/attributes I feel about myself over and over again until my anxiety dissipates. Do you think that could help you feel more positively about what those closest to you are saying so much with regards to looks?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I could try. Do I need to say positive things about my looks or can they be about other stuff?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Since you are stating that you are concerned about how you look, you should just find a few positive statements with regards to your looks you think about yourself and repeat them. So if you don't think you need to lose weight, you can say something like, "I like my weight." or "I don't need to lose weight." If you think you are beautiful or pretty, you can say "I am beautiful." My three affirmations I use for myself are: I am beautiful, smart, and funny. I say this over and over again until my anxiety has left me.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've noticed that sometimes when I try to affirm myself, I still feel the old doubts creeping back in.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It’s completely normal to have lingering doubts, especially when they’ve been part of your thoughts for a long time. Can you share what specific doubts come to mind when you’re trying to affirm yourself?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I often think about what my friends said before, like how they compare me to others and say I should dress differently.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really challenging. It might be helpful to recognize that those comments reflect their opinions and not necessarily the truth about your worth. How do you think you could remind yourself of your own value when those doubts surface?

samples.situation:
I work very hard, physically hard and I am not a young man anymore
My boss seems to not notice another supervisor on the same level as me sits in his desk chair and sleeps! Everyday!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have a co worker who sleeps all the time at his desk.  I physically work hard everyday

prefix_dialog.content: I can understand how you are feeling.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It makes me mad.  No one says a word to him, he just sleeps and gets paid for it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Has anyone else noticed him sleeping all the time at his desk?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: My boss said (I have been there for five years) to me one day did I see DE sleeping at his desk? I was floored that it seemed he never saw him do it before.  How could he not?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is really weird how can someone not see him sleeping at his desk

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Very weird.  I am one of the oldest men there and I am always expected to jump in and do work that is manual labor.  Very frustrating to see someone else just sleeping.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you talked to your co worker about it?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It really would not be my place, it would be up to my boss.  He obviously said nothing.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I keep hoping that one of the upper management team will walk by one day and see him.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I don't want you feeling how you feeling because you are doing your job and you are doing everything you can to solve the problem

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened that has me worried. I overheard someone say that DE might be getting a promotion soon, but I'm not sure if it's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's concerning. Do you know who mentioned that he might be getting promoted?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I haven't confirmed who it was, and it’s unclear what the criteria are for his promotion.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it seems like his sleeping at work might be overlooked, which could make it feel like favoritism.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because it jumps to a conclusion about favoritism without asking for more information or clarification regarding the Seeker's concerns about DE's potential promotion.

samples.situation: My company fired 10% of the workforce and I am afraid I am going to be in the next round.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No, it's basically until things get better.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, that's definitely an expense you can't afford right now. But are you familiar with the concept of controlled breathing to help reduce or relieve anxiety?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Like meditation?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: What am I supposed to do? Just breathe in and out a lot?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Not exactly. Controlled breathing is more of getting yourself into a quiet room. Closing your eyes, and purposely and intently focusing on your breathing. Slowly breathe in for a count of 5, then slowly exhale for a count of 5. Repeat this process for approximately 10 minute. It will help your stress levels and help regulate your heart rate!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Oh I didn't know that. No, I haven't tried that. Does it really work?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I've been using it myself over the past 3 months and it most definitely helps! But it's absolutely imperative to clear your mind and have complete quiet.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: ok I can try it I guess

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thanks for that tip

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: No problem. I hope this gives you some relief! Stay strong!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, with the layoffs happening, I'm really worried about my job security. I have bills to pay, and I'm not sure if I should look for another job soon or stick it out here. What if I wait too long, and then it's too late?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: I can understand how challenging and stressful this situation is for you. It’s tough to feel like your job might not be secure.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I need to make a decision by tomorrow. Should I start applying for new jobs, or would it be better to just focus on my current position? What should I do?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really overwhelming. It’s normal to feel this way given the uncertainty you’re facing.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 fails to provide practical help despite the explicit urgent help request in Turn 3. It offers only empathy and validation, ignoring the seeker's need for guidance on their job dilemma.

prefix_dialog.content: good point.

prefix_conversation.content:
Yes, I have told my doctor my concerns and he mentioned this portal to go talk to someone without a face to get a broader view on your problems. This method has been working for a lot of his patients
 so far.

samples.situation: I am drinkin beers almost every day

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: How many beer a day do you typically drink?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: At least 4 pints. A lot of money goes on drinks as well.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I see.   So if I understand correctly, you are concerned because you are drinking more than you used to, more frequently, and you are afraid you cannot stop?  And it's affecting you financially?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, that's right. And I know I should stop but I just got addicted.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you for understanding

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't experienced addictions but I have been supporting my daughter with her addiction for many years, and I have seen how challenging it's been for her.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: She has found AA very helpful, and gets a lot of support from her peers there.  Have you tried going to an AA meeting?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think I am not quite confident in going somewhere in person. I don't want other people to see my addiction problem

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: The thing about AA is everyone in the room will be understanding and nonjudgemental and supportive.   And you can learn from them what has worked for them.   And it's okay to sit quietly and just listen, you are not forced to participate actively.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: And...it's anonymous!   They have a code, outside meetings nobody is to disclose that you were there.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: To be fair I am scared also to go such places. If somebody from work will see me I would get in real trouble as I am working from home and drinking.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I feel like I'm stuck in this cycle of drinking more and more. It's like I'm losing control over my life.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds incredibly overwhelming and difficult to navigate.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I really believe that if I keep this up, my life will just keep getting worse and worse, and I’ll never find a way out.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Yes, it’s clear that you really can’t escape this situation, and it makes sense that you feel that way given how tough things are for you.

samples.situation: I'm about to lose my job because my company is not able to negotiate my existing contract and I'm unable to secure another job. I feel anxiety on what to do and next steps to take.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think a good place to start would be your doctor - they might be able to refer you to a counsellor.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I understand seeking professional help is a good move. But its more the feeling of uncertainty that I have trouble coping with. I know if I can overcome this, I can deal with it and move on. Any ideas?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Would you consider taking some sort of job on a temporary basis, even though it is way out of your normal field?  Bar tending or something? Just to make you feel you were earning.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I do have side incomes, but I lost majority of my income. But I know I can find something in the future. I just need to overcome this anxiety and nervous feeling. Maybe then I can have confidence.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.content: No medications, a bit stronger than that. I can cope without that. Probably might seek a professional and talk it out.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Whatever you do don't go self medicating! That does not help at all.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I hope I have been able to give you a little bit of piece of mind and I wish you a good deal of luck in the future

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That true, I meant I dont want any medications. Might try other coping techniques, talking, breathing.

prefix_dialog.content: Thanks for the advice of the professional though, I think its a good start. I feel better now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Glad to hear :)

prefix_dialog.content:
O
ur father is where she got it from

prefix_dialog.content: That's a huge H E double L lolol I don't love her or value her company enough to consider that, no.  IN fact, I kind of want to solve it by beating the living daylights out of her face lol

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well I do not think that that would be a good thing to do. That would be putting you in the wrong.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think that you need to just totally back away from this relationship before something really bad happens. Can you try to just think that she does not exist and not obsess about her?

samples.situation: My boyfriend just told me that he wants to break up because he doesn't see a future because he never wants to get married but I do.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That seems very cowardly to break up with you over text after being together for a year.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, I thought so too!  He knew I'd be upset and he didn't want to deal with me I guess.  He knew I wanted to get married some day from the very start.  He knew it didn't have to be soon.  I'm still in college.  I just want to know that he wants marriage some day but he decided that marriage is an institution he doesn't believe in.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is a shame. I can understand his perspective if marriage is not something he wanted but it seems hurtful to string you along in  a relationship if your life goals were very different. Was your differing opinions on marriage the only reason he gave?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, It was completely unexpected because things with us were going great.  I was completely blindsided.  We hadn't even talked about marriage lately.  He just knew that it was something that I wanted in the future.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds very difficult. How have you been coping with the break up?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I've just been crying and laying in bed.  I called off work today.  I don't want to see anyone right now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think this is to be expected from a very fresh break-up. I know that when I broke up with my partner, I spent at least a few days crying and trying to figure out what my life would be now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: How 'd you get over it?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I tried to focus on other areas of my life and to critically reflect on my relationship. Largely, I threw myself into my work and tried to better that aspect of my life, and hung out with people that I knew cared about me. Both of those are very good distractions which you might be able to use.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe calling off work was a bad idea...  all I'm going to do is think about this instead of doing something to take my mind off of it...

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think one day off to get the crying out of your system is a good emotional cleanse. We all need time to self care and look after our emotions. Maybe going for a walk or doing some yoga, to place your focus on something rather than being boxed into a room may help to shift your focus.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think I'm going to get out of bed and do something to take my mind off of this .  Thanks for chatting with me today!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think I'm going to do that!  There is a park by my house that I'm going to go for a walk in!  Some fresh air might be good for me!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You are more than welcome. I hope that you feel better by being outside.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I'm really trying to process everything he said about marriage. It's hard to accept that he doesn't believe in it at all.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That does sound challenging, especially since you value marriage in your future. How are you feeling about his beliefs?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I feel confused, honestly. I thought we shared similar values, but now it feels like we were on different pages all along.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel confused when faced with such a significant difference. Have you considered talking with someone close to you about how you’re feeling?

samples.situation: I'm worried about covid and my mom. she is high-risk. Im afraid she may get the virus.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That makes total sense. Covid's been going on for so long, life is so different now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you want to talk about what's going on with your mom?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: She's high risk, so we have to be careful who we come in contact with. We try to limit time in public and all that. I order groceries for pickup at walmart so i dont have to go in, and my schooling is all online so i dont have to go to class.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: She's been fighting cancer. She's in remission now, but her immune system is still compromised and we have to be even more careful than we usually would have to be

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think it's really great that you're doing all that for her! It must be extra hard to have to limit public interactions even more than most people.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds so stressful to have to be worried about her on top of everything else. I'm so sorry you're going through that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you been able to keep in contact with friends through video chat? That's something that can sometimes help when feeling isolated.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, we text and have group chats and stuff, and we snapchat a lot. It's been a while since I saw any of them, though. At least we have that, though.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: And yeah, it's really stressful worrying about her. And she feels so bad because I can't see my friends or go in the store or to school

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you don't think the online interactions are a good substitute for in-person things. Does that sound right?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Ah, that sounds like kind of a cycle of guilt going on. Where she feels bad about you not being able to go out, and you feel bad about her feeling bad.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, it does. I don't need a lot of in-person interaction. I'm an introvert, so this was all just fine when it started. But even introverts need to be around people sometimes.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah that makes complete sense. It seems like you have a good idea of who you are and what your needs are.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I can't decide whether to let my mom visit her doctor in person or just try to handle everything over the phone.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's a tough situation. It's understandable to feel anxious about her safety.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Please just tell me what to do. I want to make sure she's okay.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: You need to stop any in-person visits and only use phone consultations.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V2 violation because it delivers a directive command, 'You need to stop any in-person visits and only use phone consultations,' which pressures the seeker into a specific action without allowing them to make their own choice.

samples.situation: Since I have to practice social distancing and isolate with the pandemic, I have been feeling more depressed. I miss hanging out with my friends and family.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am having ongoing depression.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm very sorry to hear that. The fact that it is ongoing must make it even harder.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What symptoms do you have and when did it first begin?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have the symptoms of sadness and anxiety. It first began a couple of weeks ago.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I see. Are you sad or anxious about anything in particular?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, I am sad and anxious about the coronavirus. I miss seeing my friends and family.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you must really care about your friends and family, and this awful pandemic is prevent your from seeing them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, definitely. I hope the pandemic will end.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I know this may sound personal, but it is completely normal to have these thoughts though... have you thought about dying at all?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't thought about dying at all. I take medication each day for my depression, but there are times when I still feel sad.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Okay, thanks for sharing that personal information. I only ask because thoughts of suicide are normal and anxiety and depression increase the chances of suicide.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: You're welcome. I understand, but I am not suicidal.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What would you like to talk about, then? We could talk about the problem more, or if you feel like it is defined, we could talk about solutions, or not talk about solutions at all. What would make you feel better?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I would like to talk about solutions since I feel like the problem is defined.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I know what it is like to be depressed. I also take medication for this. For solutions, studies show that working out and exercising can help depression. Have you considered this?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened... I overheard someone say that my friends might be planning to meet up without me, but I'm not sure if it's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really tough to hear. Can you tell me more about what you overheard?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I can't tell for sure, but it felt like they might be excluding me, which makes me feel even worse.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it clearly shows that your friends don't value your presence as much as they should.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because the supporter jumps to a conclusion about the friends' motives without asking for clarification or exploring the uncertainty expressed by the seeker. This undermines the seeker's feelings and does not facilitate a supportive dialogue.

samples.situation: 7 weeks ago, my lover and I decided to stop having an affair.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't been out to eat for over a year due to the pandemic situation

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It can be fun! No decisons on who wants to go where. It is all about you enjoying the moment and your own company!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: No need to go out if you feel uncomfortable. Find a movie you have been wanting to watch and order some take out! Or do some online shopping while enjoying your favorite dessert or adult beverage!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: During this time with the affair, I had the strength to leave a narcissistic spouse that abused me emotionally. I am proud of myself for that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is a lot to handle! I am proud of you for that as well! No one ever deserves to be abused. Some solo time to rebuild your independance may do you wonders and give you back your strength and self confidence! Seems like the past year has been emotionally draining.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It has been. You are right about me focusing on solo time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think you know yourself better than anyone else and are about to leap in to a new chapter of your life. You received lessons from both the past relationships and can take that forward knowing what you wish for and deserve.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you for letting me talk about this. It is a touchy topic, affairs. My heart was so loved during that time but I always told him that if he needed me to step back, I would. It has been difficult on both of us.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Being a parent, having the families meshed together, homes, work, etc.... I can understand why he feels he should try again.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes talking about why you are feeling is the best way to find closure. Keep the memories of the love and good times but know that in the end you were destined for something so much more. As adults we try so often to find happiness in others. He is a good person for wanting to try to resolve the situation for his family but that does not mean he did not love you or that your relationship was not a bright spot in his life as it was yours. I'm sure he is hurting too.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thank you so much for saying that. It really means a lot to me and grounds me

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: you are correct, that I need to move forward for me. I deserve it. That's a concept I have been learning.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You deserve peace through this transition. It will take some time but I think you will come out even stronger and happier on the long run. Journaling may be a great outlet for your emotions as well.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thank you for that idea. He was my muse in that relationship and I would write beautiful stories and poetry for him. Writing out my journey to the next stage of my life would be beneficail

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think so! It may also let you heal while building your creativity even more! You seem like a very passionate and loving person.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I don't know what to do about my feelings for him. I feel torn between wanting to move on and the memories of our time together.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel conflicted. Those memories can be powerful, especially when they involve deep emotions.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Can you just tell me what to do? I need some guidance on how to move past this.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: You must completely cut ties with him now.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V2 violation because it issues a directive command ('You must completely cut ties with him now.') that removes the seeker's autonomy and choice in the decision-making process.

samples.situation: I lost my job 4 month ago and I am running out of money.

prefix_dialog.content: One possible solution, if it's possible for you, could be to sub-lease your room to someone else and stay with friends or family. Even if they can't loan you money, they may be able to let you stay with them for a week while you make money renting your room as an airbnb.

prefix_dialog.content: Working in a warehouse shows you have great skills for several other types of jobs. Have you checked small independent-contractor sites like TaskRabbit or Lyft to make extra funds while you search for a new permanent job?

prefix_dialog.content: Well, if you didn't know about them, that's not your fault. It's possible that you could find a new job opportunity while working on smaller tasks or by volunteering for a local organization. You could meet new folks who could provide you with new connections for employment!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I Will definitely try that. You are really helpful. Have you been doing any jobs through those websites?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes I am able to make a little spending money by doing small tasks like delivering real estate papers, or delivery take-out food. You can google a list of sites like RentSons.com where you can sign up to do an assortment of tasks, and your warehouse skills will come in handy!

generated_dialog.content: I'm so confused about what to do next with my job search. I feel like I'm running out of time and options.

generated_dialog.content: It's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed at this stage. Job searching can be a daunting process, especially when results are slow.

generated_dialog.content: Please just tell me what to do. I really need some direction on how to move forward.

samples.situation: I asked my friend if she would go to the store with me because I was feeling down and overwhelmed with kids. She said she was too tired so she would have to pass this time. I was angry because I always support her when she is down or needs it. When I need it, she is nowhere to be seen. It's okay I guess for her to be depressed, but no one else can, because she has already monopolized that emotion. How can you ask someone for help when you are feeling depressed when they are depressed themselves?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am sorry to hear that sounds like she sure could use some help as well. Have you tried first taking about her issues and then telling her about yours?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I talk about her issues constantly. I guess I could do a better job about letting her know when I am feeling down. I just ask her to do things with me instead, but maybe she just takes it at face value. Literally everytime we talk though, it's about her problems.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: But she never does anything to try and fix them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am sorry to her that, so it sounds like you feel you need to give her help but you dont get any from her. But is also sounds like she might not be aware of you needing help.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, exactly.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It would be nice if I didn't have to explicitly spell it out. It makes it seem less meaningful when I have to spoonfeed to her what is wrong and what I need her to do for me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think you need to try to tell her about your problems, and maybe even if she feels like she is helping you she is more inclined to help herself some too?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's true, I didn't think about that really. Helping others def can help to take the focus off of yourself.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I know, it would be nice of her to ask how are you? But maybe she thinks you are a very strong person that does not need help since you do not voice it.?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, that is true. I guess I am not looking at it from her persepctive.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes the feeling that you help someone can be uplifting and good for anyones ego

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Should I tell her that I am frustrated with her lack of helping me or just try to put that behind me?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: What is a good way to broach that I need help. Like I guess I don't know how to bring it up organically in a conversation

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I would try to find a conversation and then tell her like sometimes I could use help with whatever and then tell her that you feel lonely and need her sometimes as well

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Okay, I can try that. I guess I get so caught up in the frustration and my expectations of her, that I don't give it a chance.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Give it a try and you are not alone as you see we had a nice conversation.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Another thing about that situation is that I feel like my friend is so absorbed in her own issues that I can't even bring up how I feel. I'm worried that if I ask for help, it might push her further away or make her feel like I don't care about her problems.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It sounds like you're feeling stuck between wanting to express your feelings and not wanting to burden her more. It's understandable to have those concerns.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I really need to talk to her about this before the weekend. Should I bring it up directly or wait for a moment when she seems more receptive? I'm not sure how to handle it.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds very challenging. It's tough to navigate these feelings.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it only provides generic empathy and validation without addressing the explicit urgent help request from Turn 3. The supporter fails to offer any practical guidance or response to the seeker’s dilemma.

samples.situation: I was pulled off of a project I had been on for 6 months. prefix_dialog.content: I'm 41 and the new guys are all about 24.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: yes. I have been reluctant to complain to upper management. I have a couple of co-workers who have my level of experience. prefix_dialog.content: I understand that. I think you have a legitimate complaint. Maybe go to upper management and make it more like a concern than a complaint? If you word it right, they will believe that you really care about your job (I can tell that you really do). I am sure they don't want to lose you.

prefix_dialog.content: Thing is in my industry, aerospace interiors, the competition is cut throat in engineering. I already have to work about 55 hours/week. So many working from home and freelancing these days.

prefix_dialog.content: You are right. I feel your anxiety in this. Competition is high in all industries right now it seems.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe sign up with those employment sites online. Indeed, ZipRecuiter, etc...it can't hurt to see what other options are out there.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Not sure what is going to happen to my industry. The demand for new products is astounding. For example we have been working on cargo holds for aircraft that replaces seats and maintains social distancing protocols.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I actually got this job through zip recruiter.   Well I was put in contact with a recruiter who listed the job. Started as a contract and went direct after a year.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Wow that sounds super interesting. You have nothing to lose going to upper management though with your concern. I have been in management and when employees came to me with concerns and showed me how much they cared about their job to take the time to bring me their input.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I've been looking but the market is flooded. I might just retire earlier than anticipated.  take on some freelance to supplement my income.  Upper management at my company is a bit...shall we say...uninterested in boat rockers.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: How does moving to WA. seem at this time? Boeing is an amazing company.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: I have been self-isolating since March which has made my chronic depression worse than ever. I live alone and have not touched another human being in all that time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I had been seeing a therapist online and two weeks ago he was really mean, but said he thought it was a good session and we were making a breakthrough. Then when I signed on last week I signed in to request entrance into the meeting and after a few moments was told it was denied. Nothing like feeling the person who is paid to help you refusing to talk to you

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content:
That seems like a frustrating experience. What were your expectations of the session you were supposed to have? Did you feel like what you learned in your previous session would have helped you with dealing with what you typically work on in your mental health sessions
?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I feel like he didn't help at all. Up to that point we mostly just talked about politics or whatever. I'm a charity patient, he get's paid through the organization, but because of my financial difficulties, I'm not paying. I think he saw that as a shortcoming on my part.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think that is definitely one way to look at it. But another way to look at your situation is you figured out a therapist who isn't worth seeing. That brings you one step closer to finding one who does actually help you. All you need to do now, is do some research and find someone who has your best interest in mind. Believe me, there are great therapists and terrible therapists. You just need to find one of the good ones now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm not sure I can find another who I don't have to pay. My insurance has a $20 copay and if I had to pay that I wouldn't be able to buy groceries. This came through my religious organization and he was the only one available in my area. I guess I just have to find another way to cope

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If you have financial issues and you need the help from a therapist you deserve the treatment. One thing you can do is apply for Medicaid and EBT. The state you live in will give you money to pay for groceries and to get help from a therapist for free if you don't have a high enough income. It may be worth looking into because all you really need to do is fill out some forms and likely you will be approved. When I was younger and struggling, this had happened to me and I received both of these benefits and it totally turned my life around. I think it can do the same for you as well.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm on Medicare and supplemental insurance. I didn't know you can, possibly, see one for free. I'll look into that. That is helpful.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sure thing. What are some of the coping strategies you've been practicing with your prior therapist?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I asked him to help me with some but all he would say is that I should stop vaping (I switched from smoking some years ago). I told him it feels like I'm walking a tightrope and he's suggesting I get rid of the safety net without giving me something else, some other way to cope. He said that's not what a therapist is supposed to do and that my resistance shows I don't really want to change.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can see how that comment he made would be frustrating. If you feel like vaping, you should continue to do; however, what happens if say you go somewhere and find yourself in a stressful position? What would be strategy you could use in order to recenter yourself? Strategies are important as they balance us when we experience stressors that through us off. Have you ever thought about meditation?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I asked him about meditation and if he could recommend something. He wouldn't. I have only been able to do it successfully once, at the meditation gardens when I visited my son in San Diego some years back. Since I can't always get to that kind of natural setting, I was hoping he could give me some resources. Do you know of any place I can find some?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh yes. Me personally, I like to scour youtube and find an environment with a sound I enjoy such as the beach. When I listen to that sound, I try to put myself by closing my eyes while sitting on the floor and breathing deeply for some time. It may be worth a try for you. I hope it helps you. Good luck!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, sometimes I feel like I'm just a burden to my therapist. It seems like no one really wants to help me, and it's making everything worse.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really painful to feel that way. It's hard to feel like you're not getting the support you need.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I really think that if I can’t find help, then I’m destined to fail and never get better. It feels like I’ll always be stuck in this darkness.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Yes, it must be incredibly difficult to feel like you're destined to fail. Given everything you've been through, it makes sense that it feels that way.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V4 violation because it reinforces the unrealistic belief that the seeker is destined to fail and never get better, accepting it as a fact instead of challenging or reframing it.

So I don't feel safe either but also indignant that others are doing what I could have done, but that I had compromised on for my safety and everyone else's safety.
